main.content_body:
{{Short description|American singer, rapper & songwriter (born 1992)}} {{About|the musician|other uses|Anees}} {{Use American English|date=July 2022}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2022}} {{Infobox person | name = anees | image =Anees headshot.jpg | alt = | caption = anees in 2022. | alias = anees | birth_name = Anees Mokhiber | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1992|7|30}} | birth_place = [[Washington D.C.]], U.S. | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|rapper|songwriter}} | television = | parents = | awards = | website = {{URL|aneesofficial.com}} | module = {{Infobox musical artist | embed = yes | background = solo_singer | genre = {{hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[R&B]]|[[hip hop music|hip hop]]|[[pop rap]]}} | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}} | years_active = 2017–present | label = | associated_acts = {{hlist|[[Justin Bieber]]|[[Ex Battalion|JRoa]]}} }} | signature = }} '''Anees Mokhiber''' (born July 30, 1992), known mononymously as '''anees''' (stylized in small caps), is a [[Palestinian Americans|Palestinian-American]] singer, rapper, and songwriter known for his hit song, "[[Sun and Moon (Anees song)|Sun and Moon]]", becoming the first international artist to top ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]'' [[Philippines Songs]] chart. == Life and career == === 1992–2024: Early life === Anees Mokhiber was born on July 30, 1992, in the suburbs of [[Washington, D.C.|Washington D.C.]]{{Cite web |last=Lee |first=Derrick |date=2022-01-20 |title=Anees Performs For The First Time In Los Angeles For WFNM |url=https://blurredculture.com/anees-performs-for-the-first-time-in-los-angeles-for-wfnm/ |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=Blurred Culture |language=en}} He was raised and has resided in [[Northern Virginia]]. Anees is an Arab American with [[Palestinian]] and [[Lebanese people|Lebanese]] ancestry.{{Cite web |last=Ihmoud |first=Nader |date=2021-09-28 |title=Palestine in America — Blog — A Palestinian you should know: Anees Mokhiber |url=https://www.palestineinamerica.com/blog/a-palestinian-you-should-know-anees-mokhiber |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=Palestine in America |language=en-US}} Anees studied at [[George Mason University]], majoring in [[philosophy]] and [[sociology]] in 2014.{{Cite web |last=Aburdeineh |first=Mariam |date=2021-04-21 |title=Rapper and double Mason alum Anees gains musical momentum after a surprise from Justin Bieber |url=https://www.gmu.edu/news/2021-04/rapper-and-double-mason-alum-anees-gains-musical-momentum-after-surprise-justin-bieber |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=George Mason University |language=en}} His courses became pivotal to his growth as a "deep thinker and conscious lyricist." Being a minority, Anees felt accessibility and opportunity in the school, "falling in love with my time on campus, whether it was going to office hours or walking around campus during sunset." He worked as a [[pizza delivery]] man to save up for his studies.{{Cite web |date=2022-04-11 |title=anees Talks Debut Album, Dream Collabs, Performs "sun and moon" [Watch] |url=https://www.sheeshmedia.com/articles/anees-talks-debut-album-dream-collabs-performs-sun-and-moon |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=SHEESH |language=en}} While attending summer camp, Anees performed bomber [[Freestyle rap|freestyling]]: "You would, on the fly, come up with a four-bar rhyme to go back-and-forth with someone. I always felt very alive doing it." Anees attained a [[Juris Doctor]] degree in 2017 from the Antonin Scalia Law School at George Mason University in Arlington, Virginia before deciding to pursue a music career. He entered a state of [[Depression (mood)|depression]], confiding to freestyling as his [[therapy]].{{Cite web |last=Bayyouk |first=Anthony |date=2021-10-04 |title=Anees The Rapper - Arab America |url=https://www.arabamerica.com/anees-the-rapper/ |access-date=2022-05-16 |website=Arab America |language=en}} His degree allowed him "to maneuver business dealings and the legal side of the music business without being taken advantage of as an independent artist," attesting how his legal acumen became significant to his growth. His [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]] [[Ford Focus|Focus]] became his personal practice space and recording studio, developing his sounds and styles.{{Cite web |last=Bedirian |first=Razmig |date=2021-06-24 |title=Anees the Rapper on new single 'Love Is Crazy': 'I want my music to feel like the everyday human' |url=https://www.thenationalnews.com/arts-culture/music/anees-the-rapper-on-new-single-love-is-crazy-i-want-my-music-to-feel-like-the-everyday-human-1.1246322 |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=The National |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Spears |first=Baylor |date=2021-04-14 |title=DC-Area Rapper Anees Is Getting a Big Boost From Justin Bieber |url=https://www.washingtonian.com/2021/04/14/dc-area-rapper-anees-is-getting-a-big-boost-from-justin-bieber/ |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=[[Washingtonian (magazine)|Washingtonian]] |language=en-US}} === 2019–2021: Breakthrough and ''Slip'' === Anees posted an early version of "Drunk on Myself" on Instagram in 2019, showing off his flow and rap style publicly.{{Cite web |last=Rincón |first=Ally |date=2022-04-28 |title=anees Never Fails to Wears His Heart On Sleeve / Ones To Watch |url=http://www.onestowatch.com/blog/anees-new-artist-discover-sun-and-moon |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=Ones To Watch}} A year later, he uploaded a snippet of his first composition for "Slip" to TikTok. On April 14, 2020, Anees made his official debut single with "Neverland Fly", a [[Rapping|rap]] song opening up about his battle with depression and the volatility of mental health. On June 21, he collaborated with Arab producer Thanks Joey and Puerto Rican producer El Bles on the high-octane track "Brown Kid", envisioning it as an anthem for minorities. The following month, he released the song "Maybe" and continued to upload snippets of his upcoming work to promote his brand. "Slip" made its public release as Anees' next single on April 1, 2021, across music platforms, a love song he dedicated to his wife and his vulnerability. While performing the song on his Instagram Live on April 10, Canadian artist [[Justin Bieber]] joined his livestream, increasing his viewership to a total of 60,000 people. Bieber praised his musicality and started an open discussion with Anees, lasting for 45 minutes that resulted to an uptick in his Instagram following to 10,000 followers within the hour. The encounter garnered positive press, especially from the Arab community of musicians, including [[Narcy (rapper)|Narcy]], [[Massari]], and Big Hass. The success of "Slip" led to the overlapping release of the songs "Love Is Crazy", a romantic track requested by his fans, and "Drunk on Myself", an ode to self-love. He also published a performance video for "What Lovers Do", an emotive and provocative rap track that featured his signature flow.{{Cite web |last=Schwartz |first=Noah |date=2021-10-06 |title=anees Delivers His New Provocative Single "what lovers do" |url=https://sheeshmedia.com/articles/anees-what-lovers-do |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=SHEESH |language=en}} === 2021–2023: ''Sun and Moon'' === {{Main|Sun and Moon (Anees song)}} In November 2021, Anees previewed the chorus of "[[Sun and Moon (Anees song)|Sun and Moon]]" to his social media accounts to positive response, leaning into [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] and a departure from his rap sound. He released "Too Good to Be True" featuring Kevin Spears as a follow-up to this new style, with Spears producing both tracks. Anees continued to preview snippets of the track before being released officially to streaming platforms on April 6, 2022, and confirming it as his lead single for his debut album, ''Summer Camp''.{{Cite web |last=Mokhiber |first=Anees |title=anees electronic press kit |url=https://www.aneesofficial.com/epk |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=anees |language=en-US}} To promote the song, Anees launched an [[Freestyle rap|open verse]] challenge on TikTok upon its official release.{{Cite web |last=Bonoan |first=Christian |date=2022-04-21 |title=Anees Taps J Roa For "Sun And Moon Remix" |url=https://myx.global/anees-jroa/ |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=[[Myx|MYX]]}} On April 11, former [[Ex Battalion]] member JRoa uploaded his version to the site, gaining massive popularity locally, reaching 14 million plays as of May 2022. Anees reached out to JRoa to record a full duet to the song, releasing the official "Sun and Moon" remix on April 14 with an accompanying live performance video of both acts performing from different locations.{{Cite web |last=Gil |first=Baby A. |title=Meet Anees, Philippines current No. 1 selling singer |url=https://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2022/05/14/2180867/meet-anees-philippines-current-no-1-selling-singer |access-date=2022-05-14 |website=Philstar.com}} "Sun and Moon" rose to number-one on the [[Billboard charts|''Billboard'']] [[Philippines Songs]] chart dated May 7, making it the first English song to reach the summit and Anees as the first international artist to top the list.{{Cite magazine |last=Cusson |first=Michael |date=2022-02-15 |title=Philippines Songs May 7 2022 |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/philippines-songs-hotw/2022-05-07/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221228042131/https://www.billboard.com/charts/philippines-songs-hotw/2022-05-07/ |archive-date=2022-12-28 |access-date=2022-05-14 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}} As of May 2022, the track has gained 20 million streams on Spotify and 5 million views on its music video on YouTube, becoming Anees' most streamed song. In October 2023, Anees signed the [[Artists4Ceasefire]] open letter to [[Joe Biden]], [[President of the United States]], calling for a ceasefire of the Israeli bombardment of Gaza.{{Cite web |title=Artists4Ceasefire |url=https://www.artists4ceasefire.org/ |access-date=2023-12-11 |website=Artists4Ceasefire |language=en-US}} === 2024: ''Summer Camp'' === Anees released the Summer Camp album and started the tour promoting the album. The tour included many major cities, a performance on [[Jimmy Kimmel Live]], [[SunFest]], and Lovin’ Life Music Fest.{{Cite web |title="Summer Camp Album Tour" Press Release |url=https://www.aneesofficial.com/anees-tour-press-release |access-date=2024-10-02 |website=anees |language=en-US}} == Artistry and influences == Anees described his sound as genre-defying, ranging from [[Hip hop music|hip-hop]], [[Pop music|pop]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]], and [[Soul music|soul]].{{Cite web |last=SeventhQueen |date=2021-08-11 |title=Introducing Palestinian-Lebanese Rapper: Anees |url=https://yallaletstalk.com/introducing-palestinian-lebanese-rapper-anees/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230326182159/https://yallaletstalk.com/introducing-palestinian-lebanese-rapper-anees/ |archive-date=2023-03-26 |access-date=2022-05-15 |website=Yalla! Let's Talk. |language=en-US}} He cites [[Eminem]], [[J. Cole]], [[Immortal Technique]], and [[Kanye West]] as his main musical inspirations, as well as Lebanese-American poet [[Kahlil Gibran]] as his reference for his writing style. Among the Arab community, he listed [[Omar Offendum]], [[Narcy (rapper)|Narcy]], and [[DAM (band)|DAM]] as his influences. His other influences include [[Chance the Rapper]], [[Los (rapper)|King Los]], [[John Mayer]], [[India Arie]], and [[Marlon Craft]]. With his newfound success over his evolution in sound, Anees mentioned [[DMX]], [[Lauryn Hill]], [[Ed Sheeran]], and [[Rex Orange County]] as being integral in his growth.{{Cite news |last=Mudallal |first=Zainab |date=2022-07-26 |title=Anees wants to bring everyone back to summer camp for his debut tour |language=en-US |newspaper=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/music/2022/07/26/anees-dc-summer-camp-tour/ |access-date=2023-03-25 |issn=0190-8286}} == Discography == === Singles === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+List of singles, with year released and album name shown ! rowspan="2" scope="col" |Title ! rowspan="2" scope="col" |Year ! colspan="2" scope="col" |Peak chart position ! rowspan="2" scope="col" |Album |- ! scope="col" style="font-size:90%; width:3em" | [[Official New Zealand Music Chart|NZ Hot]]
Peak chart positions on New Zealand Hot 40 Singles Chart: *"Sun and Moon": {{cite web|url=https://aotearoamusiccharts.co.nz/archive/hot-singles/2022-04-15|title=NZ Hot 40 Singles|date=April 16, 2022|publisher=Recorded Music NZ|access-date=July 31, 2022}} *"Leave Me": {{cite web|url=https://aotearoamusiccharts.co.nz/archive/hot-singles/2022-09-02|title=NZ Hot 40 Singles|date=September 14, 2022|publisher=Recorded Music NZ|access-date=September 4, 2022}} ! scope="col" style="font-size:90%; width:3em" |[[Philippines Songs|PHL
Songs]]
Peak chart positions on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s Philippines Songs: |- ! scope="row" | "Neverland Fly" | rowspan="3" | 2020 | — || — | rowspan="7" {{n/a|Non-album singles}} |- ! scope="row" | "Brown Kid" {{small|(with Thanks Joey & El Bles)}} | — || — |- ! scope="row" | "Maybe" | — || — |- ! scope="row" | "Slip" | rowspan="4" | 2021 | — || — |- ! scope="row" | "Love Is Crazy" | — || — |- ! scope="row" | "Drunk on Myself" | — || — |- ! scope="row" | "What Lovers Do" {{small|(with Kevin Spears)}} | — || — |- ! scope="row" | "[[Sun and Moon (Anees song)|Sun and Moon]]" | rowspan="2" |2022 | 17 || 1 | rowspan="2" |''Summer Camp'' |- ! scope="row" | "Leave Me" | 36 || — |- !"Kiss My Wounds"{{Cite web |title=Kiss My Wounds Lyrics Chord - Lamucal |url=https://lamucal.com/chords/anees/kiss-my-wounds-1691869 |access-date=2024-09-02 |website=lamucal.com}} |2024 |— |— |Non-album singles |- | colspan="5" | "—" denotes a release that did not chart or was not released in that region. |- |} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Anees}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1992 births]] [[Category:21st-century Lebanese musicians]] [[Category:Palestinian musicians]] [[Category:Musicians from Washington, D.C.]] [[Category:21st-century male musicians]] [[Category:George Mason University alumni]]
